While the ESRS XBRL Taxonomy does not have detailed numerical XBRL elements for the corresponding quantitative disclosures, these are expected to be part of the content tagged by this textblock tag.

The anticipated financial effects are expected to be disclosed in monetary values. While the ESRS XBRL Taxonomy does not have detailed numerical XBRL elements yet, the corresponding quantitative disclosures are expected to be part of the content tagged by this textblock tag. Phase-in provisions in accordance with Appendix C of ESRS 1 might be applied.

The anticipated financial effects are expected to be disclosed in monetary values. While the ESRS XBRL Taxonomy does not have detailed numerical XBRL elements yet, the corresponding quantitative disclosures are expected to be part of the content tagged by this textblock tag. Phase-in provisions in accordance with Appendix C of ESRS 1 might be applied.

The differences between significant OpEx and CapEx disclosed under ESRS E1 and key performance indicators disclosed under Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2021/2178 are expected to be disclosed in monetary values and the corresponding quantitative disclosures are expected to be part of the content tagged by this textblock tag.

The relationship of significant CapEx and OpEx required to implement actions taken or planned to CapEx plan required by Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2021/2178 is expected to be disclosed in monetary values and the corresponding quantitative disclosures are expected to be part of the content tagged by this textblock tag.

The relationship of significant CapEx and OpEx required to implement actions taken or planned to key performance indicators required under Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2021/2178 is expected to be disclosed in monetary values and the corresponding quantitative disclosures are expected to be part of the content tagged by this textblock tag.

The relationship of significant CapEx and OpEx required to implement actions taken or planned to relevant line items or notes in financial statements is expected to be disclosed in monetary values and the corresponding quantitative disclosures are expected to be part of the content tagged by this textblock tag.

The value provided for the typed dimension should be a unique technical ID identifying the action (plan) that is supposed to be consistently applied for all related facts.
The value provided for the typed dimension should be a unique technical ID identifying the impact, risk and opportunity that is supposed to be consistently applied for all related facts.
The value provided for the typed dimension should be a unique technical ID identifying the policy that is supposed to be consistently applied for all related facts.
The value provided for the typed dimension should be a unique technical ID identifying the target that is supposed to be consistently applied for all related facts.

The value provided for the identifier element should be a unique technical ID that is the same as the value provided for its corresponding typed dimension (Identifier of impact, risk and opportunity [typed axis]) and should be consistently applied in the report. Multiple identifiers should be separated with a comma (no white spaces).

The value provided for the identifier element should be a unique technical ID that is the same as the value provided for its corresponding typed dimension (Identifier of policy [typed axis]) and should be consistently applied in the report. Multiple identifiers should be separated with a comma (no white spaces).

The value provided for the identifier element should be a unique technical ID that is the same as the value provided for its corresponding typed dimension (Identifier of target [typed axis]) and should be consistently applied in the report. Multiple identifiers should be separated with a comma (no white spaces).

The value should be presented in years. According to ESRS 1 par. 77 c, the long-term time horizon is defined as more than 5 years. By providing deviated time horizon the XBRL element represents the number of years counted from the end of the short-term time horizon.

The value should be presented in years. According to ESRS 1 par. 77 b, the medium-term time horizon is defined from the end of the short-term reporting period up to 5 years. By providing deviated time horizon the XBRL element represents the number of years counted from the end of the short-term time horizon.

The intensity value should be tagged using a unit with an appropriate denominator from the XBRL Unit Registry. If no appropriate units are available, the typed dimensions 'Type of intensity value denominator [typed axis]' ( esrs:TypeOfIntensityValueDenominatorTypedAxis) can optionally be tagged to avoid duplicate facts.
